resources.string: This is an experiment to see if mobile devices can replace a standard breathalyzer.\n\nEnter your user Id number and click a task to begin.
Read the color at the top of the screen, then click on one of the four boxes with the associated background color.

The goal of Task 1 is to click one of the lower boxes that has a background color that matches the text of the upper box.\n\nBe careful, the colors, words, and answer color change every time you click!
Watch and listen to the numbers being displayed, and then enter them in the same order
The goal of this task is to watch and listen to the numbers displayed in the upper box and then enter them in the same order.
The goal of this task is to click and hold the react button when the "X" appears on screen. When the "X" disappears, release the react button.

The goal of this task is to balance the red circle within the white circle for as long as possible.
Try to keep the red circle as close to the center of the white circle as possible.
To begin this task, you will first have to balance your phone flat like it is lying on a table.
Please tilt the device in the direction of the blue arrow; this will help balance the phone.
The goal of this task is to click the red circles as they fall down the screen, and to count the number of beeps that are played.\n\nFor best results, click slightly ahead of each circle button.
Please get a new ID number
